record.alternateTitle1: W. K. Kellogg Foundation Center for Continuing Education
record.description: George Wells Beadle (left) who will be inaugurated Thursday as chancellor of the University of Chicago, helps break ground for a unique structure at 60th near Kenwood. A $4,000,000 Center for Continuing Education will serve as a meeting place for world-famous scholars to exchange ideas and information. Emory W. Morris, president of the W.K. Kellogg Foundation which contributed more than half of the building funds, assists. Mark Patterson, 2, may have future stake in the event.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
record.noteGeneral: Photocopy of the newspaper clipping covering the groundbreaking is attached to the back.Stamp: Please return to University of Chicago Department of Public Relations. Stamp: credit line. Stamp: file copy
